entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs economy minister indicted in corruption probe: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs economy minister indicted in corruption probe: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìçVahan Kerobyan, Armenia‚Äôs former Economy Minister, was dismissed, indicted on charges of abuse of power, and placed under house arrest as part of a corruption probe. üìçThe United Kingdom-based owner of the Bank of Georgia is in ‚Äúadvanced discussions‚Äù to acquire Ameriabank, one of Armenia‚Äôs largest lenders.

entry.title: Iran insists it will not allow borders to be changed in the region

media:group.media:title: Iran insists it will not allow borders to be changed in the region
media:group.media:description:
üìçIran indicated it will ensure regional security in the South Caucasus, while criticizing the presence of ‚Äúoutsiders,‚Äù likely a reference to the European Union‚Äôs monitors along Armenia‚Äôs side of the border with Azerbaijan. üìçPrime Minister Nikol Pashinyan will participate in a first-of-its-kind nuclear energy summit in Brussels next month, alongside other world leaders. üìçFormer Economy Minister Vahan Kerobyan was dismissed, charged with abuse of power, and detained as part of an ongoing government corruption probe.. üìçArtsakh businesses reopening in Armenia: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MVnelXCc6pc

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs first combat deaths of the year: What comes next?

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs first combat deaths of the year: What comes next?
media:group.media:description:
In the latest edition of #Frontlines, hosts Karnig Kerkonian and Garo Ghazarian are joined by Armen Tatoyan, director of the Tatoyan Foundation, and Irene Victoria Massimino Kjarsgaard, an international criminal and human rights lawyer, to discuss this week‚Äôs escalation along the Armenia-Azerbaijan border. Four Armenian soldiers were killed in action Tuesday near the village of Nerkin Hand in Armenia‚Äôs southernmost Syunik region, marking Armenia‚Äôs first combat deaths of the year.

entry.title: Entrepreneurs from Artsakh rebuild after displacement

media:group.media:title: Entrepreneurs from Artsakh rebuild after displacement
media:group.media:description:
Entrepreneurs who were displaced from Artsakh during the ethnic cleansing last year had to leave more than just their homes. They had to leave the businesses that they worked so hard to build and develop. CivilNet speaks with three business owners, Arsen Tevosyan, owner of Patara Bakery, Christine Balayan, owner of Tumanyan‚Äôs Art Restaurant, and Azat Adamyan, owner of Bardak Pub.

entry.title: Russia to raise issue of Armenians‚Äô return to Karabakh in talks with Azerbaijan

media:group.media:title: Russia to raise issue of Armenians‚Äô return to Karabakh in talks with Azerbaijan
media:group.media:description:
üìçAzerbaijan warned that normalization efforts will not resume until Armenia changes its constitution to remove all references to Nagorno-Karabakh. üìçArmenia accused Azerbaijan of seeking new concessions through force, warning that the threat of another war between the two countries is looming. üìçRussia said it is planning to raise the issue of allowing Nagorno-Karabakh‚Äôs Armenians to return to their homes in direct negotiations with Azerbaijan.
